Added a fix to clear the state of singletons BEFORE pipeline execution via `TestSparkRunner` - this broke `MetricsTest` in post commit (I ran locally before merging). Simply moving this before executing the pipeline.
Merging when tests here pass and post commits pass locally for me.

Notice that this extra rebase was to add the IO to the parent pom and the javadoc pom.

This is some cleanup about issues I found while doing the last touches for HBaseIO. It is mostly repeated unneeded stuff, and some layout issues. Note I didn't create a JIRA because this is minor.
R: @davorbonaci  [I would normally put dhalperi but he should be tired of reviewing my PRs now :)].

We have done rebase for this branch HadoopInputFormatIO. Now this repository is in sync with the remote repository apache/beam. The Jenkins build is red right now. We are looking into finding a resolution for it.
R: @jbonofre
There are some overlaps with IT resources provided by other IOs like elasticsearch. Dipti can we talk together where to put this ?

## This PR provides initial support for the Beam Model in streaming via triggers, panes and watermarks.
### Notes:

1. Tests backing this rely on `CreateStreamTest` which is Spark runner's equivalent of `TestStreamTest` in direct runner.
2. `SparkTimerInternals` currently uses Spark's batchTime as the "synchronized processing time". 
3. This is implemented for `GroupByKey` without `Combine` optimizations - those should be easy enough to follow.
4. This is not a full streaming support yet, and so `ROS` in streaming is not yet enabled - follow soon.
And finally; R: @kennknowles ðŸ˜„

Fixing this now
(@rangadi, the dependency is fine on a quick scan; but will confirm after your peek/before merging.)

Some test flakes may appear running on Jenkins (not locally) - I'm afraid it has to do with the timeout I provide for streaming tests and I'm not sure how to solve this.
One way would be a very generous timeout, on the expense of very long builds.
I could also try and come-up with a "kill-switch" once done.

Anyway, please review this in the meanwhile since it's not going to be a quick look anyway.

R: @aaltay PTAL

- Updated setup.py and tox to test different install paths

R: @tgroh since some of those come from of he Harness work.

ROS profile inherited parallel `all` + me clearing Metrics between executions = stale state.
Current state was that "clear" didn't assign `null` and so following executions "enjoyed" a pre-existing instance (which is why it doesn't break master). Once it is cleared with `null` you could get hit by "race-like" behaviour between executions, hence the NPEs.
Run Spark RunnableOnService
